Stump (Amendment) Act, No. 49 of 1968  Tr. D.—0, 11/67.
Aw Acr To AMEND THE StaMP ORDINANCE.

BE it enacted by the Queen’s Most Excellent  Majesty, by and _with the advice and consent of the  Senate and the House of Representatives of Ceylon  in this present Parliament assembled, and by the  anthority of the same, as follows: —
4. This Act may be cited as the Stamp (Amend- shore titte,  ment) Act, No. 49 of 1968.
2. Section 3 of the Stamp Ordinance (hereinafter ameodment  referred to as ‘ the principal enactment ”), is hereby of section 8  amended in sub-section (1) of that section as jy?"  follows :—
(1) in paragraph (b) of that sub-section by the
substitution, for the words “* The Minister ””,  of the words “* The Commissioner ””; and
(2) in paragraph (c) of that sub-section by the
substitution, for the words “‘ The Minister ””,  of the words ‘‘ The Commissioner ””.

3. (1) Part 1 of Schedule A to the principal sisesdment  enactment is hereby amended as follows: — otras et  (a) in item 16, by the insertion, immediately after Pitta  the proviso to paragraph (7) of that item, Secment,

Writing or bond either in respect of, or  creating a pledge of, corporeal movables in  favour of an. approved credit agency as  defined in section 3 of the Mortgage Act. "";  and

2 — Stamp (Amendment) Act, No. 49 of 1968  Provided that a retransfer or  reassignment of such policy of  insurance to the original transferor  shall be charged with the same duty  as was paid on the original conveyance  or transfer. ”; and  (ii) by the renumbering of paragraph (12) of  that item as paragraph (13) theres,  (2) The amendment made to the principal enactment  by paragraph (a) of sub-section (1) shall be deemed to  have come into effect on April 1, 1957.
